item.title: Expert Spécialiste du Financement du Secteur Agricole, CAT I
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Mission d'assistance technique aupres du Ministere de l'Agriculture de l'Elevage (Phase transitoire)

L'objectif général de l'intervention est de contribuer à la mise en place d'un partenariat efficace et pertinent entre la République du Bénin et l'Union Européenne pour le développement du secteur agricole et la sécurité alimentaire et nutritionnelle du Bénin. L’objectif particulier consiste à appuyer le Ministère de l’Agriculture, de l’Elevage et de la Pêche (MAEP), dans la conception de la nouvelle stratégie de développement du secteur agricole et de ses modalités de mise en oeuvre et de pilotage.

*Expert Spécialiste du Financement du Secteur Agricole, CAT I – 100 j/h * BAC+5 minimum en agronomie, agroéconomie ou équivalent

Le consultant doit disposer d’au moins 12 ans d'expérience dans le développement rural.

Il disposera d'au moins 6 ans d'expérience dans le financement du secteur agricole, avec au moins une expérience réussi d'octroi de subventions publiques et de (micro) crédit dans le monde agricole, au moins une expérience réussie en matière d’ingénierie de formation et l'élaboration de plan de formation basé sur l'analyse des besoins et des profils.

Il doit avoir une très bonne connaissance des institutions de financement du secteur agricole et du secteur agricole au Bénin.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to elena_bellitto@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Chef de Mission, Expert des Politiques et Stratégies de Développement Agricole, CAT I
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Mission d'assistance technique aupres du Ministere de l'Agriculture de l'Elevage (Phase transitoire)

L'objectif général de l'intervention est de contribuer à la mise en place d'un partenariat efficace et pertinent entre la République du Bénin et l'Union Européenne pour le développement du secteur agricole et la sécurité alimentaire et nutritionnelle du Bénin. L’objectif particulier consiste à appuyer le Ministère de l’Agriculture, de l’Elevage et de la Pêche (MAEP), dans la conception de la nouvelle stratégie de développement du secteur agricole et de ses modalités de mise en oeuvre et de pilotage.

Chef de Mission, Expert des Politiques et Stratégies de Développement Agricole, CAT I – 120 j/h

Le chef de mission aura une formation BAC+5 minimum en agronomie, agroéconomie, économie rurale, sociologie rurale ou équivalent avec une expérience générale d’au moins 12 ans dans le développement rural.

Il doit disposer d'au moins 5 ans dans les pays en voie de développement. Il aura une expérience spécifique dans l'élaboration, le suivi et l’évaluation de politiques et de stratégie de développement agricole ainsi que la mise en œuvre de réformes sectorielles dans le secteur agricole.

Une expertise pratique dans les domaines du conseil agricole, de développement des services à l’exploitation agricole, de l’installation des jeunes dans l’agriculture dans des pays en développement sera appréciée.

Il doit disposer d’au moins 6 ans d'expérience dans le domaine des finances rurales et agricoles avec au moins une expérience dans la budgétisation axée sur les résultats ainsi qu'une bonne connaissance de l’ECOWAP/PDDAA, des orientations stratégiques de la CEDEAO et exigences juridiques relatives à l'élaboration de stratégie agricole et mobilisation de ressource.

Une connaissance des procédures de la Commission Européenne constituera un avantage comparatif.

Une connaissance de la problématique du développement rural ou de pays de la sous-région au Bénin est souhaitée.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to elena_bellitto@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Value Chain Specialist (Category II)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Formulation of the ARISE+ Project

On November 3, 2016, the draft Action Document of ARISE+ will be presented to the Quality Support Group of the European Commission Directorate for Development and Cooperation. Comments received during this consultation will be incorporated in a revised draft Action Document that will be made available to and finalised by the experts. A second Quality Support Group will take place tentatively on March 7, 2017 before a final decision on ARISE+ is reached by Q3 of 2017.

The mission’s main objective is to assist the EU Delegation to Vietnam formulate the ARISE+ Programme in Vietnam with a focus on its support to private sector component.

The mission will identify the list of priorities where the programme’s scarce resources should be allocated. This includes the list of sectors most likely to benefit from support to access markets in the EU, with maximum impact on job creation and poverty reduction.

Value Chain Specialist (Category II) (25 working days)

  • At least a Masters Degree in Economics, Business, Trade or another relevant discipline. In its absence, 10 years professional experience working on private sector support and export promotion in developing countries.
  • At least 6 years experience on Trade, Standards and/or Private sector support;
  • Experience working with business organisations or producers organisations in Vietnam.
  • In-depth knowledge of at least three value chains in Vietnam. - Strong references on export promotion in Vietnam.
  • Previous experience on EU market access is an advantage.
  • Excellent communication skills and ability to work in a multicultural environment
  • Excellent level of English.
  • Good knowledge of Vietnamese.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to Lina_Forgeaux@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

On November 3, 2016, the draft Action Document of ARISE+ will be presented to the Quality Support Group of the European Commission Directorate for Development and Cooperation. Comments received during this consultation will be incorporated in a revised draft Action Document that will be made available to and finalised by the experts. The mission’s main objective is to assist the EU Delegation to Vietnam formulate the ARISE+ Programme in Vietnam with a focus on its support to private sector component.

item.title: Chef de mission (expert de catégorie 1) – 2eme mission
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Realisation de deux (02) etudes relatives au diagnostic des capacities de la CPS/SDR et de l'interprofession riz du Mali et l'elaboration de plans de renforcement de leurs capacities

Description of the Project:

Les objectifs de la présente mission portent sur la réalisation des deux études suivantes :

  • Étude 1 : Élaboration, sur la base d’un diagnostic approfondi, d’un plan d’action pour le développement des capacités institutionnelles de la CPS/SDR;
  • Étude 2 : Élaboration, sur la base d’un diagnostic approfondi, d’un plan d’action de renforcement des capacités techniques et organisationnelles de l’Interprofession Riz du Mali.

Experience and Qualifications Required:

Niveau universitaire équivalent au moins au Master en économie, agroéconomie, en science sociale ou dans un autre domaine équivalent et disposant des expériences et connaissances suivantes:

  • Avoir au moins 12 ans d’expériences professionnelles dans le renforcement des capacités des organisations faîtières des filières agricoles dont au moins trois ans d’expériences professionnelles spécifiques dans le renforcement des capacités des organisations faîtières des filières agricoles dans les pays de l’Afrique francophones ;
  • avoir réalisé en tant que chef de mission au moins trois missions similaires c'est-àdire des missions portant sur le diagnostic des capacités des interprofessions agricoles assorties de l’élaboration de stratégies pour le développement des capacités de ces interprofessions;
  • avoir des expériences professionnelles ayant des liens avec les filières agricoles au Mali sera un avantage;
  • avoir de solides capacités à communiquer en langue française.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to nicte_garcia-soria@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Chef de mission (expert de catégorie 1)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Description of the Project

Les objectifs de la présente mission portent sur la réalisation des deux études suivantes :

  • Étude 1 : Élaboration, sur la base d’un diagnostic approfondi, d’un plan d’action pour le développement des capacités institutionnelles de la CPS/SDR ;
  • Étude 2 : Élaboration, sur la base d’un diagnostic approfondi, d’un plan d’action de renforcement des capacités techniques et organisationnelles de l’Interprofession Riz du Mali.

Experience and Qualifications required:

Niveau universitaire équivalent au moins au Master en statistiques ou en planification ou en Agronomie, ou en Agroéconomie ou dans un autre domaine équivalent et disposant des expériences et connaissances suivantes :

  • Avoir au moins 12 ans d’expériences professionnelles dans des systèmes de statistiques (nationaux et/ou Agricoles) couvrant les domaines suivants : planification, suivi-évaluation des politiques et programmes agricoles, production et diffusion de statistiques Agricoles dont au moins trois ans d’expériences professionnelles spécifiques avec les services des statistiques Agricoles dans les pays de l’Afrique francophone ;
  • Avoir coordonné, en tant que chef de mission, au moins trois missions similaires, c'està- dire des missions d’évaluation des capacités des services de statistiques agricoles et d’élaboration de stratégies de développement des capacités de ces services ;

item.title: Category III Expert
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Description of Project

The Global Objective of this evaluation is to provide the project stakeholders, primarily the EU Delegation to Laos, with sufficient information about the project performance of the Pool Fund (its relevancy, efficiency, effectiveness, impacts and sustainability), document lessons learned and provide practical recommendations for future programmes.

The Specific Objectives are built on five key parameters for the evaluator to study; and these are:relevance, efficiency, effectives, impact and sustainability as described below:

  • Assess the relevance of the project design (its activities and objectives) in addressing the priority issues in the target communities;
  • Assess to what extent the available resources have been used economically in delivering the project outputs/results, in terms of quantity, quality and timeliness (efficiency).
  • Assess the major achievements of the project to date in relation to its stated objectives and intended results based on the logframe (effectiveness);
  • Assess to what extent the project is contributing to a long-term positive effect on the entire society in the uplands (impact);
  • Assess whether the positive outcomes of the project are likely to continue after the project (sustainability).

Experience and Qualifications Required

  • S/he will have at least a Bachelor degree in Agriculture/Rural Development or equivalent

General professional experience:

  • S/he has at least 3 years of professional experience relevant to the Agriculture/Rural Development sectors

Specific professional experience:

  • S/he will have past training delivery experience at the subnational level proven by at least one assignment;

  • S/he has at least one past experience in project/programme evaluation, particularly in a rural development project/programme.

Language skills

  • English Proficiency

  • Communication skills in Lao would be an asset.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to nicte_garcia-soria@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Category I Expert
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Description of the Project:

The Global Objective of this evaluation is to provide the project stakeholders, primarily the EU Delegation to Laos, with sufficient information about the project performance of the Pool Fund (its relevancy, efficiency, effectiveness, impacts and sustainability), document lessons learned and provide practical recommendations for future programmes.

The Specific Objectives are built on five key parameters for the evaluator to study; and these are: relevance, efficiency, effectives, impact and sustainability as described below:

  1. Assess the relevance of the project design (its activities and objectives) in addressing the priority issues in the target communities;
  2. Assess to what extent the available resources have been used economically in delivering the project outputs/results, in terms of quantity, quality and timeliness (efficiency).
  3. Assess the major achievements of the project to date in relation to its stated objectives and intended results based on the logframe (effectiveness);
  4. Asses to what extent the project is contributing to a long-term positive effect on the entire society in the uplands (impact);
  5. Assess whether the positive outcomes of the project are likely to continue after the project (sustainability).

Experience and Qualifications Required

•S/he has an advanced university degree (minimum Master) in Agriculture/Rural Development studies or relevant International Development Studies or equivalent professional experience of at least 153 years if candidate does not possess an advance university degree.

General professional experience:

•S/he has at least 12 years of professional experience relevant to the Agriculture/Rural Development sectors

Specific professional experience:

•S/he has minimum 3 years' experience in the implementation and management of development projects or programmes

•S/he has least one relevant experience with Programme Based approaches,

•S/he has at least two relevant past experiences with EU Project Cycle Management and, in particular with evaluation procedures,

•S/he will also have team leader experience proven by at least two missions as head of mission/team leader.

Language skills

•English Proficiency

•Communication skills in Lao would be an asset.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to nicte_garcia-soria@dai.com

item.title: Senior Expert in Banking Regulation and Supervision
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Support to the preparation of the twinning fiches for the National Bank of the Republic of Belarus

The assignment will consist of supporting the preparation of the twinning fiche for the National Bank of the Republic of Belarus (NBRB) as the beneficiary and project partner of the first twinning project in Belarus.

Expert in Banking Regulation and Supervision (Category I)

  • At least 12 years of general professional experience in the sector related to the Lot;
  • At least a Master’s Degree, preferably in macroeconomics, financial management, banking regulation or other relevant field or, in its absence, at least 5 additional years of professional experience on top of the 12 required under general professional experience above
  • At least 5 years of professional experience in the area of banking regulation and/or supervision in the EU countries or countries covered by the Enlargement Policy;
  • Experience in drafting project proposals for technical assistance projects (at least one reference);
  • Good prior knowledge of the banking sector regulatory and supervision situation of the Republic of Belarus would be an asset;
  • Background in Twinning matters would be asset;
  • Fluency in both written and spoken English
  • Knowledge of Russian would be an asset.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to [LinaLina_Forgeaux@dai.com](mailto:lina_forgeaux@dai.com)

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Perito Cat. II – perito em avaliação de projectos de desenvolvimento institucional
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Avaliação Final do PAANE II

O Objectivo Global deste projeto è a avaliação final do Programa de Apoio aos Actores Não Estatais (PAANE II) . Especificamente, após consulta e análise da documentação disponível, das visitas as províncias do projecto e contactos/entrevistas com os diferentes interlocutores, os consultores deverão:

  • Avaliar em que medida os resultados esperados do projecto foram alcançados;
  • Elaborar uma lista exaustiva de lições aprendidas e boas práticas adquiridas com o projecto;
  • Elaborar um estudo de viabilidade e análise sectorial que analise a pertinência do apoio da União Europeia à articulação das OSC com as autoridades locais, bem como, de que maneira como o Governo de Angola encara este apoio;
  • Identificar novas áreas para apoiar;
  • Identificar as limitações e restrições à implementação do projecto, susceptíveis de terem afectado a sua performance;
  • Avaliar o gau de sustentabilidade do projecto;
  • Recomendar medidas correctivas, para maximizar os resultados e a sustentabilidade do projecto;
  • Na base das constatações retiradas do terreno, recomendar eixos e metodologias de intervenção numa perspectiva de um próximo apoio às organizações da sociedade civil e autoridades locais previsto no âmbito do 11º FED.

Perito Cat. II – perito em avaliação de projectos de desenvolvimento institucional -

  • Pelo menos 6 anos de experiência de trabalho no desenvolvimento, implementação e avaliação de programas/políticas relativas a projectos de mobilização social/apoio ao desenvolvimento da sociedade civil
  • Experiência em desenvolvimento local (desenvolvimento e capacitação institucional, descentralização e desconcentração, participação da sociedade civil nas políticas públicas, etc) - Bons conhecimentos e experiência em gestão, administração e implementação de procedimentos de monitoria processual e financeira de projetos de cooperação UE–ACP. - Conhecimento do contexto institucional e da sociedade civil em Angola especialmente nas províncias
  • Experiência em avaliação de programas institucionais
  • Domínio da língua portuguesa e inglesa (falada e escrita)

Outras competências:

  • Experiência relevante em avaliação de projectos de apoio institucional às OSC
  • Experiência profissional relevante em monitoria e avaliação de projectos de desenvolvimento e apoio institucional (em particular no eixo de governação)
  • Assessoria técnica para o desenvolvimento institucional de organizações da sociedade civil,
  • Conhecimento do contexto institucional e da sociedade civil em Angola
  • Conhecimentos e experiência comprovada dos procedimentos FED
  • Bom conhecimento da abordagem da Gestão de Ciclo de projecto (Quadro Logico) da União Europeia
  • Domínio do português e inglês falado he escrito
  • Capacidade de trabalhar de forma eficiente com as autoridades governamentais a nível nacional, provincial e local, bem como com as OSC

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to elena_bellitto@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Chefe de equipa (perito Cat. I)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Avaliação Final do PAANE II

O Objectivo Global deste projeto è a avaliação final do Programa de Apoio aos Actores Não Estatais (PAANE II) . Especificamente, após consulta e análise da documentação disponível, das visitas as províncias do projecto e contactos/entrevistas com os diferentes interlocutores, os consultores deverão:

  • Avaliar em que medida os resultados esperados do projecto foram alcançados;
  • Elaborar uma lista exaustiva de lições aprendidas e boas práticas adquiridas com o projecto;
  • Elaborar um estudo de viabilidade e análise sectorial que analise a pertinência do apoio da União Europeia à articulação das OSC com as autoridades locais, bem como, de que maneira como o Governo de Angola encara este apoio;
  • Identificar novas áreas para apoiar;
  • Identificar as limitações e restrições à implementação do projecto, susceptíveis de terem afectado a sua performance;
  • Avaliar o gau de sustentabilidade do projecto;
  • Recomendar medidas correctivas, para maximizar os resultados e a sustentabilidade do projecto;
  • Na base das constatações retiradas do terreno, recomendar eixos e metodologias de intervenção numa perspectiva de um próximo apoio às organizações da sociedade civil e autoridades locais previsto no âmbito do 11º FED.

Chefe de equipa (perito Cat. I) – perito em gestão e avaliação de projectos de desenvolvimento institucional – 40 dias de trabalho

  • Formação universitária ao nível de Mestrado num ramo das Ciências sociais bem como formação complementar numa área relevante para a missão
  • Pelo menos 12 anos de experiência de trabalho em áreas relevantes para a missão: apoio institucional, apoio à sociedade civil, políticas de descentralização, experiência em redes de OSC em países em desenvolvimento, projectos de mobilização social/desenvolvimento da sociedade civil (de preferência nos PALOP)
  • Experiência como avaliador e coordenador de avaliação de pelo menos 3 programas de apoio ao desenvolvimento da sociedade civil (de preferência nos PALOP e no âmbito do FED)
  • Conhecimento do contexto institucional e da sociedade civil em Angola
  • Domínio da língua portuguesa e inglesa (falado e escrito)

Outras competências:

  • Experiência relevante em avaliação de projectos de apoio institucional às OSC
  • Experiência profissional relevante em monitoria e avaliação de projectos de desenvolvimento e apoio institucional (em particular no eixo de governação)
  • Assessoria técnica para o desenvolvimento institucional de organizações da sociedade civil,
  • Conhecimento do contexto institucional e da sociedade civil em Angola
  • Conhecimentos e experiência comprovada dos procedimentos FED
  • Bom conhecimento da abordagem da Gestão de Ciclo de projecto (Quadro Logico) da União Europeia
  • Domínio do português e inglês falado e escrito
  • Capacidade de trabalhar de forma eficiente com as autoridades governamentais a nível nacional, provincial e local, bem como com as OSC

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to elena_bellitto@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Electoral/Political Expert (Cat. I - Senior) and Senior Legal Expert (Cat.I)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
EEM The Gambia 2016

The overall objective of this assignment is to contribute to support democracy in the context of the Gambian Presidential Election scheduled for December the 1st, 2016.

The specific objective of the assignment is to provide reporting to the European External Action Service, Democracy and Election Observation Division (hereafter referred to as EEAS) and the European Commission, Foreign Policy Instruments (here after referred to as EC FPI) on the ongoing electoral process during and after the Gambian presidential election. The experts will also provide the EEAS and EC with an analysis relating to recommendations with a view to further aligning all elements of the electoral process to international standards, in line with the criteria contained in the EC Communication on Electoral Assistance and Observation [COM(2000)191]. Elements of this report may eventually be shared with Electoral Authorities and the Government.

One Team Leader – Electoral/Political Expert (Cat. I - Senior) for 49 working days

*** One Legal Expert (Cat. I - Senior) for 48 working days **

General Qualifications and Skills:

Education at least Master’s Degree Academic level in Political Science, International Relations, Law or any other discipline relevant to the assignment. In its absence, equivalent professional experience (more than 12 years).

General Professional Experience: At least 12 years of experience in the area related to Lot 7.

Specific Professional Experience:

  • Significant work experience in the field of electoral assistance and/or electoral observation and analysis, preferably as part of an EU Election Observation Mission or an Election Technical Assistance project of the EU or of other international organisations, in position of managing the mission or drafting statements and reports. This work experience will include the participation as Core Team member or independent expert in at least four (4) election observation missions by international or domestic organizations such as: Election Observation Missions, Election Assessment Teams, Election Expert Mission, Follow-up Mission, Exploratory Missions, Needs Assessment Missions.
  • Familiarity with the legal and regulatory framework for the elections as well as international and regional standards for elections. In this context the “Compendium of International Standards for Elections” is an important background document;
  • Proven work experience on electoral legislation and good understanding of election dispute resolution systems;
  • Excellent understanding of the functioning of election management bodies;
  • Experience in assessing the media landscape and media framework, according to international and regional standards, particularly as regards to elections, will be an asset;
  • Previous experience in the country and/or the region and good networks within the different sectors of society in order to be immediately operational will be an asset.

Language skills:

  • Excellent written and spoken English.
  • Reporting will be done in English.

Specific to Team Leader’s profile

In addition , the Team Leader will present the following profile:

  • Excellent communication and inter-personal skills;
  • Excellent report drafting skills;
  • Coordination and management skills and past experience of management in a similar assignment, preferably as Deputy Chief Observer in an Election observation mission or as Chief Technical Adviser in a technical assistance project;
  • Proven knowledge and field experience of EU policies and programmes in the area of human rights, democratisation and good governance;
  • Proven work experience in project implementation and budget management of international civilian missions, preferably as part of an EU Election Observation Mission or an EU Election Technical Assistance project is an asset.
  • Proven work experience of contractual and budgetary procedures of EU external action and related mechanisms is an asset.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to CorinaMaria_Campian@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS
